summary: This document contains official count sheets from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for August 10, 2019, and telephone call logs from August 9-11, 2019, showing calls to and from extension 6317. The records detail inmate population counts and specific telephone activity around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death. This document is a detailed telephone call log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, showing calls made from specific inmate stations (e.g., 6317, 6385) on August 9-10, 2019. It records call times, durations, dialed numbers, and technical routing data, providing a timeline of communications from the facility during a critical period.

keyFacts: Official prison count sheets are dated August 10, 2019, from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The inmate census on August 10, 2019, was 758 individuals.
Telephone logs show activity for extension 6317 from August 9 to August 11, 2019.
Calls involving extension 6317 include both incoming calls and outgoing calls to number 6468.
The document consists of administrative prison records and telephone logs, with no named individuals identified in the provided text.
The log shows detailed telephone activity from inmate stations (6317, 6385, 6381, 6229) at the MCC on August 9-10, 2019.
Station 6317 was highly active on August 10, making numerous calls to station 6313 and external numbers like 16464230779 and 12019560693.
The log includes technical telephony data such as circuit IDs, routing classes, and call statuses (e.g., DIALING, ANSWER, IN CONVERSATION, BUSY).
The dates correspond to the period when Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at the MCC, suggesting these may be logs related to his unit or adjacent units.
Calls were made to both internal extensions (e.g., 6313, 6450) and external numbers, indicating a mix of facility and outside communication.
